ETYMOLOGY: Abbreviation of the English word 'mistress', which historically referred to any woman in authority or head of a household. By the 17th century, the abbreviation 'Mrs.' came to be used specifically for a married woman.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A title or courtesy designation used before the surname or full name of a married woman.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于已婚妇女姓氏或全名之前的称谓，即“夫人”或“太太”。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Mrs. Henderson taught us history in high school.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 亨德森夫人曾在高中教我们历史。
